term.title: isosteric enthalpy of adsorption

item.text: When the addition of the differential amount of component idniσ or dnis is effected at constant pressure p, the differential molar enthalpy of adsorption, Δ a H i σ or Δ a H i s also called the isosteric enthalpy of adsorption (q st) is defined as: Δ a H i σ =- q st , σ = U i σ- and Hi^g is the partial molar enthalpy of component i in the gas phase, i.e. (∂Hg/∂nig)T,p,nig
